titleStmt.title: Charles, by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. to all and singular mayors, recorders, customers, comptrollers ... of and within all and singular the port townes ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: Commissioning mayors and other officials at port towns (except London, Dover, etc.) to grant passports, with the form of the oath for the clerk in charge of the register book.
"Witnesse our selfues at Westminster, the nineteenth day of Nouember, in the sixth yeare of Our Raigne."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
